title: When humanity becomes a space civilization do you think at some point we will all abandon earth for other more suitable planets? - Quora

response.answer_text: It will be an extraordinary achievement to become a space civilisation that does not need this planet. And if our descendents can get by without Earth I expect they can get by without any planets. I think planets (other than this one) will be more effort than they are worth to colonise, especially if you are a capable space civilisation capable of making space habitats to order. The planets of other stars, if ever some way to reach them is developed (unlikely), will be the most difficult to colonise of all - and the presence of alien life, unlike in the galactic empires of science fiction, is much more likely to make colonising harder, not easier. Note that I think space is much harsher and it's resources more difficult to exploit than the enthusiasts like to say. If we ever successfully colonise space, it will be testament to the extraordinary wealth and resources of Earth's economy.
